meanings.definition: The study of the writings of the early Christian theologians.
meanings.sent1: In my patristics class, we analyze the ancient texts of early Christian thinkers.
meanings.sent2: She decided to major in patristics to delve deeper into the works of the Church Fathers.
meanings.sent3: Studying patristics feels like deciphering a fascinating puzzle from the past.
meanings.sent4: The world of patristics is a treasure trove of wisdom waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: Through patristics, we gain insight into the beliefs of early Christian scholars.

meanings.definition: A branch of theology that focuses on the teachings of the Church Fathers.
meanings.sent1: The professor's lecture on patristics shed light on the doctrines of the Church Fathers.
meanings.sent2: Many scholars find inspiration in the profound teachings of patristics.
meanings.sent3: Exploring patristics is like taking a journey through the intellectual heritage of Christianity.
meanings.sent4: The influence of patristics on modern theology is undeniable.
meanings.sent5: Through patristics, we connect with the theological insights of early Christian leaders.
